title: 華爾街日報：郭文貴被指控是中國間諜

Chinese Tycoon Holed Up in Manhattan Hotel Is Accused of Spying for Beijing

Exiled businessman Guo Wengui, a frequent critic of China’s Communist Party, is a spy for Beijing, U.S. research firm alleges

For the past four years, Chinese businessman Guo Wengui has lived in an 18th-floor apartment at the Sherry-Netherland Hotel in New York, where he fires off social-media missives that purport to expose corruption at the highest levels of the Chinese government.

He said his efforts have rattled Beijing and that he has applied for U.S. asylum to protect himself. China hard- liners in the U.S., including President Trump’s former
adviser Steve Bannon, have rallied to his side.

But a Washington-area research firm in a commercial dispute with Mr. Guo alleged in a Friday federal court counterclaim that he is a spy for the Chinese government.

His attorney, Daniel Podhaskie, said the allegation was “utterly false and lacks any credibility.”
The origins of the commercial dispute, pending in a Manhattan federal court, go back to January 2018, when Mr. Guo hired the firm Strategic Vision US LCC with a contract valued at $9 million, according to court filings by both sides.
